result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Carl Goviera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held 02-01-2016
Transcript of Plea Hearing held 12-02-2015
Order Denying Expungement - Copy mailed to Anthony Goviera

09:29 AM Defendant Anthony Carl Goviera in court. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  This matter comes before the Court regarding expungement.  The history in this matter is Mr. Goviera was sentenced in February 2016 by Judge Duvall and the Court has read the JOC and in the original JOC Doc. #14 is silent as to any issue regarding expungement.  There is an Amended JOC Doc. #20 is silent as to expungement.  The DOC in Doc. #26 filed Petition and Stipulation to waive appearance and hearing.  In that document signed by Mr. Goviera he states I have not made a good faith effort and ask the court extend my probation.  Based on that, Mr. Goviera's probation was extended DOC #28 for 1 year 0 months.  In January 2020, DOC filed notice for failure to meet expungement.  In May 2022 the same agent filed Doc. #39 Certificate of Discharge and Satisfaction for Expungement.  Mr. Seifert sent a letter to Attorney Rivard at the time, expungement was contemplated at the original negotiations, expungement allowed if successful.  The offer included both a DAGPA and Misdemeanor in the JOC.  Mr. Goviera did complete the DAGP on the felony dismissing 15CF29 11/29/2017.  On the expungement if determined whether or not the Court believes Mr. Goviera successfully completed the terms of probation, State has not objection.  State leaves in the hands of the Court buy report, expungement was contemplated back when.  If Mr. Goviera now satisfied all terms of probation, State has no objection to expungement.  Court reads 973.05 .015 1m(a) 1.  The only record at this time is the minutes.  Mr. Seifert refers to you pleading to a felony that could be expunged that is consistent with his record in his file regarding negotiations.  When you get to the judge talking in the notes, there isn't a shred of reference to expungement.  Your attorney and the State's attorney clearly talked about it but there is no record the judge said he would do it.  Court can't create expungement if the judge didn't order it at the time.  Nobody order a transcript to see.  Under Wis. 2017 WI 64 paragraph 12.  Your stipulation to extend simply said you did not comply.  The second one said you did that.  Defendant addresses the Court to explain the situation why he was extended, the restitution was joint and several and he was the youngest.  Court finds Judge Duvall did not order expungement at the time of sentencing.  You may be able to come up with a transcript that said he did.  Under State v. Ozuna, I find you did not meet the conditions of probation with the extension.  Court denies your request for expungement.  Court asks Mr. Seifert draft an order.
Review hearing on May 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Anthony Carl Goviera
Current: 321 Gilwest, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 12-02-2015)
Prior: 1023 Briar Lane, Altoona, WI 54720 United States
Copy Manually Filed.

Defendant Anthony Carl Goviera in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant and counsel consent to Judge appearing by phone from Buffalo County.  State informs court of plea agreement.  Defendant will plead to count 1 in 15CF29, DPA.  State would move to dismiss counts 2, 3, 4; counts 2, 3, 4 will become new charges in 15CF52 as counts 1, 2, 3; all 3 counts in 15CF52 defendant will plead to; request court order PSI with parties free to argue sentencing; opportunity for expungement; DPA in count 1 of 15CF29 with 3 yrs. deferred, standard agreement, restitution no yet agreed upon.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing in 15CF52.  Court notes waiver and binds defendant over for trial.  Court advises defendant of charges/max penalties as stated in the Information in 15CF52 and count 1 in 15CF29; advises defendant of his constitutional rights; reviews DPA; only expunge if successfully complete probation.  Defendant pleads guilty of counts 1, 2, 3 in 15CF52 and guilty of count 1 in 15CF29; plea colloquy; Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and pleas done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty of counts 1, 2, 3 in 15CF52 and defer acceptance of guilty plea in 15CF29 and approve the DPA; Dismiss counts 2, 3, 4 in 15CF29 w/o prejudice; order PSI.  State moves to dismiss 15CF45 and withdraw motion to forfeit bond.  Bond addressed & clarified, bond in 15CF29 shall also serve as bond in 15CF52, with consent of surety; dismiss motion to forfeit bond; remove jury trial.
Manually Filed.
